summary: This is an email chain from September 10, 2020, discussing budget constraints for processing documents related to the Epstein case. The correspondents indicate they are 'seriously out of money' for the fiscal year, which is delaying the hiring of a vendor to scan and process material from the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) and the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR). The name 'Maxwell' is mentioned as being 'on radar'.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the email chain as being 'on radar' in the context of budget discussions for processing Epstein-related materials.

events.title: Budget discussion for Epstein document processing
events.description: Email correspondence reveals the office is out of money for the fiscal year, delaying the immediate hiring of a vendor to scan and process Epstein-related documents from the SDFL and OPR.

keyFacts: As of September 10, 2020, the office handling Epstein case materials was out of money for the fiscal year, halting new expenditures.
There was an urgent need to hire a vendor to scan and process Epstein-related documents from the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) and the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR).
The name 'Maxwell' is referenced as being 'on radar' in the context of these budget and processing discussions.
The email chain suggests a financial constraint impacting the pace of document processing related to the Epstein investigation.
